svg.text: A Metaphorical Framework for Understanding LLM-Assisted Development

g.text: The Golf Course = The Possibility Space

Just as a golf course is a physical manifestation of challenge and strategy, the "development course" represents the high-dimensional embedding space through which an LLM navigates when processing prompts.
Each region of this space has different properties—some areas are well-defined and stable (the green), others are ambiguous and uncertain (the rough).

Every time you refine or rephrase a prompt, you're taking another "shot" through the possibility space, attempting to land closer to your goal. Like golf, each shot is informed by where you currently are, what you've learned from previous attempts, and your strategic assessment of the remaining distance.
Convergence occurs when prompt specificity and model understanding align perfectly with intent.
II. Terrain as Embedding Space Topology

text.tspan: • Example: "Create a bar chart showing quarterly revenue"

g.text: Key Insight: Undulation Represents Confidence Variance

Rough terrain = volatile, unstable semantic regions where slight prompt changes cause large output variations. Smooth terrain = stable regions where outputs remain consistent despite minor prompt perturbations.
III. Shot Trajectories: Navigating High-Dimensional Space

text.tspan: When visualized as arcs, each shot through the course represents a
traversal through the vector embedding space. The arc's properties map to:

g.text: Proportional to semantic distance between prompts. Longer arcs = major reformulations, shorter = refinements.
Indicates how context evolves. Smooth curves = gradual refinement. Sharp turns = conceptual pivots.
Determines which terrain zone you've reached and confidence level achieved at that iteration.
The 3D arcs are projected onto the 2D visualization using perspective mathematics, creating natural depth perception.
Each shot begins where the last landed—context accumulates through the conversation.
Shots progressively land in smoother terrain as prompt specificity increases.
IV. Strategic Implications for Prompt Engineering
The Golf Mindset Applied to LLM Interaction
Before prompting, ask: Is this a "precision"
Adjust your approach and patience accordingly.
Golf: Choose club and power based
on current position and goal distance
based on current context and remaining
In rough? Use broad, exploratory prompts.
If output misses target, don't start over—
use it as context for next refinement.
Each "bad" shot teaches you about the space.
Different "hole types" represent distinct categories of prompting challenges:
VI. From 2D Visualization to N-Dimensional Reality
The golf course visualization is a 2D projection of the actual high-dimensional vector space where LLMs operate.
While the true embedding space might have 4096+ dimensions, we collapse it into an intuitive 2D topology that
preserves the essential relationships: distance from goal, terrain confidence, and trajectory paths.
By mapping abstract AI concepts to familiar golf mechanics, we gain intuitive understanding of how to navigate complexity, when to be patient, and how progress emerges through iteration.

svg.text: "Like golf, development is not about perfection on the first try—
it's about strategic iteration toward a goal through uncertain terrain."
Development-as-Golf © 2025 — A Framework for LLM-Assisted Creation
